title: Ginger for Nausea
content_en: Ginger (Zingiber officinale) is commonly used to help mild nausea and digestive discomfort. Typical preparations include teas, capsules, and chews. Safety: may interact with anticoagulants; avoid high doses during pregnancy without medical advice.

title: Honey for Cough (Adults)
content_en: A spoonful of honey in warm water or tea may soothe an acute cough. Avoid in children under 1 year due to infant botulism risk.
